When she mounts the chariot, let him murmur the verse, ‘Adorned with Kimsuka flowers, of Salmali wood’ (MB. In the morning, after she has been washed, sitting on northward-pointed Darbha grass, (all over her body) including her head, she sits down to the west of the fire on northward-pointed Darbha grass, facing the east.

01 जननाद्यस्तृतीयो ज्यौत्स्नस्तस्य तृतीयायाम् ...{Loading}... जननाद्यस्तृतीयो ज्यौत्स्नस्तस्य तृतीयायां प्रातः सशिरस्कं कुमारमाप्लाव्यास्तमिते वीते लोहितिम्न्यञ्जलिकृतः पितोपतिष्ठते १ Oldenberg ...{Loading}... 1 On the third (Tithi) of the third bright fortnight after his birth, in the morning the father has the child washed, including his head, and after sunset, when the evening-red has disappeared, he worships (the moon), holding up his joined hands. 02 अथ माता शुचिना ...{Loading}... अथ माता शुचिना वसनेन कुमारमाच्छाद्य दक्षिणत उदञ्चं पित्रे प्रयच्छत्युदक्शिरसम् २
